endpoints.desc: Gets all currently active pushers for the authenticated user.

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** This is a unique identifier for this pusher. See ``/set`` for
more detail.
Max length, 512 bytes.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** The kind of pusher. ``"http"`` is a pusher that
sends HTTP pokes.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** This is a reverse-DNS style identifier for the application.
Max length, 64 chars.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A string that will allow the user to identify what application
owns this pusher.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A string that will allow the user to identify what device owns
this pusher.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
This string determines which set of device specific rules this
pusher executes.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** The preferred language for receiving notifications (e.g. 'en'
or 'en-US')
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A dictionary of information for the pusher implementation
itself.

res_tables.desc:
Required if ``kind`` is ``http``. The URL to use to send
notifications to.

The format to use when sending notifications to the Push

res_tables.title: string

endpoints.title: Gets the current pushers for the authenticated user

endpoints.desc:
This endpoint allows the creation, modification and deletion of `pushers`_
for this user ID. The behaviour of this endpoint varies depending on the
values in the JSON body.

example.req:
POST /_matrix/client/%CLIENT_MAJOR_VERSION%/pushers/set HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "lang": "en",
  "kind": "http",
  "app_display_name": "Mat Rix",
  "device_display_name": "iPhone 9",
  "profile_tag": "xxyyzz",
  "app_id": "com.example.app.ios",
  "pushkey": "APA91bHPRgkF3JUikC4ENAHEeMrd41Zxv3hVZjC9KtT8OvPVGJ-hQMRKRrZuJAEcl7B338qju59zJMjw2DELjzEvxwYv7hH5Ynpc1ODQ0aT4U4OFEeco8ohsN5PjL1iC2dNtk2BAokeMCg2ZXKqpc8FXKmhX94kIxQ",
  "data": {
    "url": "https://push-gateway.location.here/_matrix/push/v1/notify",
    "format": "event_id_only"
  },
  "append": false
}

req_body_tables.desc:
Required if ``kind`` is ``http``. The URL to use to send
notifications to. MUST be an HTTPS URL with a path of 
``/_matrix/push/v1/notify``.
req_body_tables.title: string

req_body_tables.desc:
The format to send notifications in to Push Gateways if the
``kind`` is ``http``. The details about what fields the
homeserver should send to the push gateway are defined in the
`Push Gateway Specification`_. Currently the only format
available is 'event_id_only'.
req_body_tables.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** This is a unique identifier for this pusher. The value you
should use for this is the routing or destination address
information for the notification, for example, the APNS token
for APNS or the Registration ID for GCM. If your notification
client has no such concept, use any unique identifier.
Max length, 512 bytes.

If the ``kind`` is ``"email"``, this is the email address to
send notifications to.
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** The kind of pusher to configure. ``"http"`` makes a pusher that
sends HTTP pokes. ``"email"`` makes a pusher that emails the
user with unread notifications. ``null`` deletes the pusher.
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** This is a reverse-DNS style identifier for the application.
It is recommended that this end with the platform, such that
different platform versions get different app identifiers.
Max length, 64 chars.

If the ``kind`` is ``"email"``, this is ``"m.email"``.
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** A string that will allow the user to identify what application
owns this pusher.
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** A string that will allow the user to identify what device owns
this pusher.
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
This string determines which set of device specific rules this
pusher executes.
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** The preferred language for receiving notifications (e.g. 'en'
or 'en-US').
JSON body.title: string

JSON body.desc:
**Required.** A dictionary of information for the pusher implementation
itself. If ``kind`` is ``http``, this should contain ``url``
which is the URL to use to send notifications to.
JSON body.title: PusherData

JSON body.desc:
If true, the homeserver should add another pusher with the
given pushkey and App ID in addition to any others with
different user IDs. Otherwise, the homeserver must remove any
other pushers with the same App ID and pushkey for different
users. The default is ``false``.
JSON body.title: boolean

responses.description: One or more of the pusher values were invalid.

Max length, 512 bytes.

pushers.title: Pushers

get.summary: Gets the current pushers for the authenticated user

post.description:
This endpoint allows the creation, modification and deletion of `pushers`_
for this user ID. The behaviour of this endpoint varies depending on the
values in the JSON body.

app_display_name.description:
A string that will allow the user to identify what application
owns this pusher.

app_id.description:
This is a reverse-DNS style identifier for the application.
It is recommended that this end with the platform, such that
different platform versions get different app identifiers.
Max length, 64 chars.

If the ``kind`` is ``"email"``, this is ``"m.email"``.

append.description:
If true, the homeserver should add another pusher with the
given pushkey and App ID in addition to any others with
different user IDs. Otherwise, the homeserver must remove any
other pushers with the same App ID and pushkey for different
users. The default is ``false``.

data.description:
A dictionary of information for the pusher implementation
itself. If ``kind`` is ``http``, this should contain ``url``
which is the URL to use to send notifications to.

format.description:
The format to send notifications in to Push Gateways if the
``kind`` is ``http``. The details about what fields the
homeserver should send to the push gateway are defined in the
`Push Gateway Specification`_. Currently the only format
available is 'event_id_only'.

url.description:
Required if ``kind`` is ``http``. The URL to use to send
notifications to. MUST be an HTTPS URL with a path of 
``/_matrix/push/v1/notify``.

data.title: PusherData

device_display_name.description:
A string that will allow the user to identify what device owns
this pusher.

kind.description:
The kind of pusher to configure. ``"http"`` makes a pusher that
sends HTTP pokes. ``"email"`` makes a pusher that emails the
user with unread notifications. ``null`` deletes the pusher.

lang.description:
The preferred language for receiving notifications (e.g. 'en'
or 'en-US').

profile_tag.description:
This string determines which set of device specific rules this
pusher executes.

pushkey.description:
This is a unique identifier for this pusher. The value you
should use for this is the routing or destination address
information for the notification, for example, the APNS token
for APNS or the Registration ID for GCM. If your notification
client has no such concept, use any unique identifier.
Max length, 512 bytes.

If the ``kind`` is ``"email"``, this is the email address to
send notifications to.

400.description: One or more of the pusher values were invalid.

schema.description: The rate limit was reached for this request

retry_after_ms.description:
The amount of time in milliseconds the client should wait
before trying the request again.

post.summary: Modify a pusher for this user on the homeserver.

accessToken.description: The access_token returned by a call to ``/login`` or ``/register``
accessToken.name: access_token
